name: 英語會話（二）
comment: 建議修習輔系第一年時選修
goals: Acquire the attitude that is conducive to having English conversation.
Know the stages involved in the English conversation process.
Acquire the skills to open, sustain and close an English conversation.
Learn the vocabulary for topics commonly mentioned in daily conversations.
Acquire the skills to perform FTA’s (Face Threatening Acts) like requesting, rejecting a request, hiding true feelings, and deflecting embarrassing questions.
Learn how to conduct phone conversations.
Acquire the knowledge and ability to conduct conversations at a job interview.
syllabus:
**Time:** Thursdays, 3:30-5:20            **Classroom:** 誠305

**Objectives**: The goal of this course is to **enhance students’ English-speaking competence output** by **broadening their scope** of English conversation and **enhancing their communication skills in real-life situations**. At the same time, it will try to **build confidence** and **motivate** them to **actively participate in English conversation autonomously**. In order to do so, there will again be a **five-pronged approach** to the course this semester:

1.  Firstly, the **course textbook** presents natural language in authentic contexts, and helps **develop conversation management strategies**.

1.  Secondly, there will also be **supplementary materials**. These will vary over a range of areas and at appropriate times, so that students can to familiarize themselves with topical language spoken in various popular settings.

1.  Thirdly, over the course of the first-half of the semester, students will undertake a **panel discussion task-based project**, in which task groups are asked to **investigate areas and topics** that are of interest to them, and then **orally** **present their findings** as a group to the class**.**

1.  Fourthly, over the course of the second-half of the semester, there will be an emphasis on **teaching practice** in relation to conversation**.** In pairs or groups of three, students will **plan a 30-minute+ lesson** in a series of stages and then **teach the lesson to the class.** Learning how to plan a conversation class will provides students with a real-life experience and real interface between being a student and becoming a member of the teaching profession.

1.  Finally, students need to **practice speaking** **English** outside of class. All significant autonomous English-language encounters (at least **six experiences**) should be **recorded in a notebook/portfolio** and handed in at the end of the semester.

**N.B. All five elements** **will be evaluated/assessed** when calculating the final grade.

**Guidelines and Requirements: The Rules!**

1.  Punctual attendance is required. Being on time is polite. **Talk to or email me** if you can’t attend class.
2.  **Actively participate** in class discussions.
3.  This is a **Flip Class**. **Homework must be done** for the class to work properly. This includes **reviewing** and **previewing** class chapters.
4.  You need to **submit** drafts or reflections **_several times_** during the semester.
5.  **All Task Journal** **assignments** must be done and be **on time**.
6.  **No eating** during class, but **drinks** **are allowed**.
7.  **Smartphones**, tablets, etc, must be **turned off** unless needed in class.

**Grading Policy****: The Business!**

Final Grades will be given and assessed on student performances in the following areas:

**1)** Attendance + Participation: 10%

**2)** Classroom/Homework assignments: 20%

**3)** Panel Discussion Task: 20% (Drafts, Presentations and Reflection)

**4)** Movie Review: 10%

**5)** Teaching Task: 20% (Drafts, Presentations and Reflection)

**7)** Autonomous Speaking Practice Portfolio: 20%
